intro: Myristica philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine nutmeg tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is closely related to the nutmeg tree (Myristica fragrans). The plant produces a distinctive fruit that contains the aromatic seed known as mace, which is used in cooking and traditional medicine. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and has glossy, dark green leaves. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts within its native habitat.
